item.title: Fundamentals of Dictionaries
item.description: Letâ€™s say you want to create an inventory of your video games. You are interested in storing information like name, genre, platforms, and ratings. You would like to access this information simply by knowing the name of the video game. Instead of using a database, you compare how practical it is to use dictionaries rather than lists. With a list, you need to store the information sequentially and scan through the whole list to find a particular video game name.
